 Hey, Sreejasudhakaran!

**Welcome back to the #1 AI newsletter in the world.**

Hereâ€™s a glimpse into what we have today:

* The AI that saved a life.

## **The Latest Developments in AI**

ğŸ“ˆ **[AIâ€™s Largest Cloud Deal Ever](https://www.theverge.com/ai-artificial-intelligence/776170/oracle-openai-300-billion-contract-project-stargate)**

Starting in 2027, Oracle will provide data center power to OpenAI under Project Stargate. The historical $300B, five-year agreement will increase Oracleâ€™s cloud revenue by 77%, cementing it as a major AI player.

ğŸŒ [**YouTube Rolls Out AI Dubbing**](https://blog.youtube/news-and-events/multi-language-audio/)

After two years of testing, YouTube is making its multi-language audio feature available platform-wide. Early data shows dubbed content drives over 25% of watch time from non-original language viewers.

ğŸ’° **[Perplexityâ€™s Value Surges Again](https://techcrunch.com/2025/09/10/perplexity-reportedly-raised-200m-at-20b-valuation/)**

Just two months after an $18B valuation, Perplexity has raised another $200M at $20B. With revenue closing in on $200M ARR, the AI-first search engine is fueling talk of a serious rival to Google.


----------

###### Todayâ€™s Sponsor

## **[Ito.ai](https://taaft.co/itoai-s/)** â€“ Your Open Source Jarvis

View image: (https://media.beehiiv.com/cdn-cgi/image/fit=scale-down,format=auto,onerror=redirect,quality=80/uploads/asset/file/0735354a-9040-49e1-a095-a5978d3cc4b2/itomainimg.jpg?t=1757524278)

Caption: 

**What if your voice could write better than your hands?**

Ito pipes voice into every text box for lightning-fast rewrites, tone changes, fixes, and more; up to **6Ã— faster than typing**.

This isnâ€™t just voice-to-text. It's voice-to-intention. Drop your cursor anywhere, talk, and watch the magic happen.

* **Open-Source Power** â€“ Fully customizable and privacy-first architecture.

* **Lightning Fast** â€“ Zero to email, code snippet, or tweet without ever having to type.

* **Intent-Based Writing** â€“ Speak your thoughts, get polished content (not just transcribed words).

* **Universal Integration** â€“ Works in Slack, Notion, Google Docs, Cursor, or any app with a text box.

One tap, speak your mind, done. **Free early access now on Mac** (Windows next week).

Download Ito.ai (https://taaft.co/itoai-s/)

###### Coming in Hot

## AI Tools of the Day

1. ğŸ“ˆ **[Fefi](https://taaft.co/fefi-r/)** is your command center for AI-driven financial intelligence, helping you analyze stocks, monitor markets, and see real-time insights all in one place.

3. ğŸ“Š [**AI Infographic Generator**](https://taaft.co/venngageigg-r/) creates polished infographics that make complex ideas easy to understand from text prompts.

5. ğŸ’¬ [**ReplyAgent**](https://taaft.co/replyagentai-r/) automates Reddit marketing by turning conversations into a steady channel for traffic and customer growth.

6. ğŸ“¸ [**ScreenSnapAI**](https://taaft.co/screensnapai-r/) makes screenshots smarter by auto-naming them and opening AI chats about whatever you capture.

7. ğŸ§ [**Auphonic**](https://taaft.co/auphonic-r/) is your AI sound engineer that automatically turns raw recordings into professional audio ready to publish.

8. ğŸŒ [**LingoSub**](https://taaft.co/lingosub-r/) helps you learn languages naturally by watching your favorite videos with subtitles and AI translations.

9. ğŸ§© **[Diffra](https://taaft.co/diffra-r/)** captures everything visual on a webpage and turns it into organized, ready-to-use assets right in your browser.

10. ğŸ“ [**Interpret**](https://taaft.co/interpret-r/) helps organizations optimize communication with live transcription, translation, and broadcast tools.

###### Mind-Blowing

View image: (https://media.beehiiv.com/cdn-cgi/image/fit=scale-down,format=auto,onerror=redirect,quality=80/uploads/asset/file/50817e5f-428c-4198-b0f8-43cb2451197e/telepathy.jpg?t=1757590723)
Follow image link: (https://taaft.co/alterego-r/)
Caption: 

Alterego is one of those ideas that feels straight out of science fiction: a wearable that lets you [**â€œspeakâ€ without making a sound**](https://taaft.co/alterego-r/).

It listens for the tiny signals your brain sends toward your speech system and turns them into words before you ever say them out loud. Not your private thoughts, only what you actually mean to communicate. That means you can type with no keyboard, search the web silently, chat with apps hands-free, or even hold quiet back-and-forth conversations. Beyond the cool factor, it has a powerful use case as well: giving people who have lost their voice a way to talk again. ğŸ§ ğŸ—£ï¸

Check out Alterego (https://taaft.co/alterego-r/)

###### Open Source Finds

## From the Source

âš¡ **[Self](https://github.com/Nutlope/self.so/)** is a personal site builder that uses Qwen 2.5 72B to transform your LinkedIn profile into a polished website.

âš¡ **[Second Me](https://github.com/mindverse/Second-Me/)** is a prototype for building a personal AI self that preserves your context, defends your interests, and amplifies you.

â¤ï¸ [**Open Lovable (v2)**](https://github.com/firecrawl/open-lovable/) lets you chat with AI to generate React apps, built as an example project by the Firecrawl team.


----------

â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”

###### AI Finds

## Beyond the Feed

ğŸŒ‘ **[Coding Like a Caveman](https://arstechnica.com/ai/2025/09/developers-joke-about-coding-like-cavemen-as-ai-service-suffers-major-outage/)**

Claudeâ€™s recent outage was short (half an hour), but the reaction said it all. Devs are hooked, and when AI goes dark, so do their workflows.

ğŸª [**The Catch With AI Tutors**](https://theconversation.com/how-does-ai-affect-how-we-learn-a-cognitive-psychologist-explains-why-you-learn-when-the-work-is-hard-262863)

A cognitive psychologist warns that when AI makes schoolwork effortless, it risks erasing the struggle that actually builds real skills.

ğŸ‘€ **[The Scorecard AI Still Lacks](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=RJLfqu6lw-Y)**

The message is simple: AI is useful when we know its limits. But without clear benchmarks and accountability, we risk letting it fool us.

ğŸ©º [**Haley: The AI That Saved a Life**](https://www.statnews.com/2025/09/10/ai-cancer-treatment-custom-doctors-response/)

A man built his own AI medical agent that analyzed his lab results, flagged abnormalities, and ultimately led to a life-saving diagnosis.

ğŸ§® [**Cracking the Code of Scaling Laws**](http://arxiv.org/abs/2509.07909v1)

Instead of spending billions testing model size vs. data, researchers say scaling laws can be uncovered using inverse problems (a physics math trick).

actually about filtering fast.

Kapil Kale <https://www.linkedin.com/in/kapilvkale/> at Tremendous 
<https://www.tremendous.com/> watched a month of qualified candidates ignore 
their roles. Not because of money or requirements.

Tremendous <https://youtu.be/2zVgVGkcH1U> was a black box. Smart people don't 
join companies they can't understand.

They built a public handbook explaining how they actually work, including 
remote policies, compensation philosophy, and what they believed mattered â€” the

subject: Reminder: Attempt TIC 2025 Round 1 - Quiz
body:
Tata Imagination Challenge 2025

Hi Sreeja Thati,

Every idea needs a launchpad. For theÂ Tata Imagination Challenge 2025, it begins withÂ Round 1 â€“ the Tata Quiz.Â This is your first step toward bringing your idea to the stage it deserves.

Round 1: Tata Quiz is already live â€“ test your knowledge, showcase your speed, and secure your Participation Certificate.

Quiz Details:

  • Duration: 20 minutes
  • Questions: 20 MCQs (60 seconds each)
  • Scoring: Accuracy + Speed (faster completion gets ranked higher)
  • Marking: No negative marking

Before you attempt, brush up on the world of Tata:

  • Tata Central Archives
  • Tata Tomorrow University
  • Official Tata Portal

How to Attempt:

  1. Visit the [Opportunity Page â€“Â Click Here]
  2. Click on the Verify/Play button underÂ Round 1: Tata Quiz
  3. Follow the instructions to begin

System & Proctoring Requirements:

  • Laptop/Desktop with webcam & mic access (8GB RAM recommended)
  • Stable internet (>10 Mbps)
  • Install the Unstop SmartHire App (Windows/Mac only)
  • Attempt in one uninterrupted sitting
  • Full-screen mode, no tab switching or interruptions
  • Face verification before and during the quiz

Once started, the timer runs continuously. Ensure youâ€™re prepared before beginning.

Register now, attempt the Tata Quiz, and take your idea one step closer to the national stage.

All the best,
Team Tata Imagination Challenge 2025

subject: The $5k hiring system (sell to clients)
body:
Today weâ€™ve got another banger Client Ready Workflow for you.

My 7-figure Hiring System.

I like this one for 2 reasons:

* Companies who are hiring are making money. AKA they have money
and can pay for your service.
* Hiring is a hassleâ€¦finding the right people, interviews,
updates. AKA itâ€™s a big problem we can help solve.

Youâ€™ll get:

* A workflow breakdown
* The problem the workflow solves
* How itâ€™s structured/how it works
* A template you can grab for free (and sell to your own clients)

Letâ€™s dive in.

I worked with a 7-figure coaching business that had a big issue:

They were drowning in hiring admin work and losing great
candidates because of slow follow-up.

Think of how many companies say â€œweâ€™ll get back to you in 3 daysâ€
but donâ€™t get back to candidates for 2 weeks.

I built a complete Hiring Automation System for them.

As a result, they reduced hiring admin from ~15 hours to ~2 hours
per week and improved candidate experience dramatically.

Hereâ€™s exactly how it works, why every growing business needs
this, and how you can grab the templates for free.

-----------------------
The Problem This Solves
-----------------------

Some wild stats:

* Stat 1: 70% of job seekers lose interest if they donâ€™t hear
back within one week of an interview (Addison Group)
* Stat 2: 57% of job seekers lose interest when the process drags
on (general study)
* Stat 3: 83% of candidates say a negative interview experience
can change their minds about a role or company they once liked
(LinkedIn)

Which means:

* If youâ€™re slow, youâ€™ll lose applicants
* If you have a bad process, youâ€™ll lose applicants
* If you lose the best applicants, your business will start
underperforming

You can see how this becomes a negative spiral.

What does this tell us?

That by automating your hiring process, you will close better
candidates faster.

--------------------
How The System Works
--------------------

Hereâ€™s the complete workflow:

Part 1: Application Intake Automation

* Monitors Typeform for new sales position applications
* Automatically creates ClickUp tasks with all candidate details
* Maps form data to custom fields (name, email, phone, experience
level)
* Sets initial stage to "Intake" for immediate team visibility

â€‹
Part 2: First Interview Automation

* Triggers when ClickUp task moves to â€œInterviewing 1â€ stage
* Sends personalized email invitation using candidateâ€™s first
name
* Includes scheduling link for manager interview
* Posts email copy as comment in ClickUp for team tracking

â€‹
Part 3: Final Interview Automation

* Activates when candidate reaches â€œInterviewing 2â€ stage
* Sends congratulatory email about advancing to final round
* Provides scheduling link for final interview
* Maintains complete audit trail in ClickUp

â€‹

----------------------
Real Example in Action
----------------------

New Application Received: Sarah Johnson applies for sales
position via Typeform

System Response (Instant):

* ClickUp task created: â€œSarah Johnsonâ€
* All contact details mapped to custom fields
* Team gets notification of new candidate

First Interview Stage: HR moves Sarah to â€œInterviewing 1â€ in
ClickUp

Automated Email (Triggered immediately): â€œHi Sarah, Our team
loved your video & the rest of your application. Weâ€™d love to
extend an invitation to learn a little more about you over a
call. Please book a meeting with our manager Nick using this
linkâ€¦â€

Final Interview Stage: Sarah advances to â€œInterviewing 2â€

Automated Email (Triggered immediately): â€œHi Sarah, Thanks so
much for the great interview. Weâ€™d like to invite you in for our
final interview. Please book using this linkâ€¦â€

Notice how itâ€™s personal, mentions their progress, and keeps

The Batch top banner - September 10, 2025 (https://info.deeplearning.ai/e3t/Ctc/LX+113/cJhC404/VXdFRM1pJK1gVWqJGT2l9PJYW7Pgndt5CjHP8N5JQGlz3prCCW7lCdLW6lZ3kzW8FvD6Y6xtCrjVKlW0t8d0qKLW7t0_1r2VXMnVW5wY9zf4VRHFWW4t50Xj5cFYTxVnygf96bMFWgW1XqmzH3HQkLxW2T5V1C6BVJRKW3__G2M82cdTxW3WLK6h7sQS2WW515dQF5rW6VQVKnGzG2wnMbCMTjWLPf7cvRN1fv5ZRSPlLqW25fC3K82NFG4W32GdWL7bH_GzN96Ftp8j9sxSW3qLD0G6MRN-6W73k-YZ8tl05sW7jLj428mqBjZW8jh3PR7Bd1bqW1ldssf8XsVTrW8g8ND45LXzHnW87C15V3f6fd4f31dKZq04 )

Subscribe (https://info.deeplearning.ai/e3t/Ctc/LX+113/cJhC404/VXdFRM1pJK1gVWqJGT2l9PJYW7Pgndt5CjHP8N5JQGlg3l5QzW6N1vHY6lZ3ltW7dszd39cyLV4W8Ht2sD82nPT5W898ZMR7HXQbxW7pvs7T3K7Ds6W1WdG3T80nR3wW8SZS6J39KdHdVg61Zp7WkzTCV2NzzB3sfrS5W5zvpmN2Bz9-MW55ZpTQ5s03nVW72Q4mH5MVhXFN1FvVVC3c5TVW4yK0Wn6d6MD-W1wDfKm6pTm_1W3dM6355p9ydMW7mD_p53vhXBpW2RDy967npxNNW2BDr0D20dxJkW3PXgHJ3t3YlpW1gKFWd1gYFTpW6CgtJb8tFnWlW91Y6h13FZ8RSf1b-LZF04 )   Submit a tip (mailto:thebatch@deeplearning.ai?subject=RE%3A%20Tips%20and%20News)

Dear friends,

This week, Coursera held its annual conference in Las Vegas. A major theme was the shift from knowledge- to skills-based education, which will help many individuals, businesses, and educational institutions. This annual gathering brings together leaders from academia, business, and government to discuss the latest in education and workforce development, and I was delighted to compare notes with others about the latest developments.

Greg Hart, Courseraâ€™s wonderful CEO, spoke about creating a skills-based approach to education. For individuals who want to improve their job prospects, shifting the emphasis from gaining knowledge to gaining skills can be very helpful. Iâ€™ve also seen many businesses increase their focus on skills-based hiring and employee development.

What does this mean? A lot of traditional education focuses on knowledge. After earning a degree, you know a lot! In contrast, a skills-based approach focuses on developing practical abilities and improving what you can do with what you know. While knowledge (such as understanding how RAG works) is useful, it is even more valuable when you can do something with it (such as build a RAG system).

AI, being a very practical field, has always had a strong emphasis on applied skills, but in an era when people are questioning the value of academic degrees, other sectors would also benefit by shifting toward skills. For example, instead of asking if an art history major understands their subject, we might ask what skills they have acquired that would enable them to complete useful tasks. This mindset shift can help educational institutions deliver training that is more helpful for finding jobs.

A skills-based mindset is useful:

- For individuals, as skills give you competencies to get meaningful work done.

- For businesses, which can assess job candidatesâ€™ skills and also help employees develop new skills that enable their teams to get work done.

- For educational institutions, which help individuals gain access to more opportunities by imparting skills as well as knowledge.

While skill-based education applies to many sectors, not just engineering (you can learn skills to perform tasks in human resources, marketing, finance, and much more), it is highly relevant to AI. Skill at steering coding assistants and applying AI building blocks (like prompting, RAG, evals, and so on) lets you build more valuable software. To help learners build these kinds of applied abilities, Coursera is introducing a series of â€œskill tracksâ€ programs.

A second theme at the conference was the education communityâ€™s rapid pace of exploration in using AI to improve learner experiences. For example, Coursera announced a new Role Play feature that lets instructors give a large language model instructions akin to system prompts to create chatbots that let learners practice certain interactions. For example, after teaching communication skills, a course might invite a learner to role-play having a conversation on a difficult issue with a chatbot to gain practice for real conversations.

Generative AI will transform education in ways that go well beyond chatbots. Iâ€™ll have more to say about this in the future!

Finally, on a personal note, I was glad to see Courseraâ€™s partners warmly welcome Greg Hart. As the companyâ€™s Chairman and Co-founder, it has been my privilege to support Greg and his  teamâ€™s tireless work to serve learners. The world keeps changing, and so thereâ€™s always more to learn and â€” more important â€” to help others learn. Iâ€™m grateful to Greg, the Coursera team, and Courseraâ€™s partners for working to serve learners.

It has been 12 years since the first Coursera Conference, and despite all the progress we have made (183M registered learners to date), the work that remains seems as important and as exciting as ever.

Keep building!

Andrew

Google Must Share Data With AI Rivals

AI companies that aspire to compete with Google in search and other information-retrieval applications got a boost from the United States government.

Whatâ€™s new: A federal court ruled (https://info.deeplearning.ai/e3t/Ctc/LX+113/cJhC404/VXdFRM1pJK1gVWqJGT2l9PJYW7Pgndt5CjHP8N5JQGkn5m_5PW50kH_H6lZ3p3W42CDz83RC920W4BdLtQ7Y4v76W6F-YLJ60ZR8dN5-kl4V-D8M6W6yr_Gq3hdx2_W1SHgzc7_WSKcW5bVGVk17Vy-5W2zhmvg14l8zWW3GwPFz7Vz8l1W19BXLb3FL8PWW1lznwF7gKkt0W5R_4PY27Pc90W7bq7lY2ghsMlW5H3rSJ6cSPlPV3r6hH74-LQ4W58Ft496NpX5FW3lTQWZ90gz1PW2k2J-q7qTv0wVkWCTN9bh774W4Hy3yx2XKLs5N6kGCwvfqLMjW1GPx0R7z-DHTW4Gmhwy7fvpBkN56vrG374-FJW5s-WXb3PZ49YN7_qwmRl_s2bW7T_MPL2FFMkNW8rW_zM1lXy-hW4nLHJ771LjN1W3PSGj74ljKZGW3fZS4D8jGGNBW43Hmpm1-gYRJf4v5Zjx04 ) that Google must turn over its current search index â€” a database of web links and pages â€” to U.S.-based AI rivals including OpenAI, Anthropic, and Perplexity as well as search engine competitors. However, the court stopped well short of the U.S. Department of Justiceâ€™s request that the company be broken up.

How it works: Last year, the same judge ruled (https://info.deeplearning.ai/e3t/Ctc/LX+113/cJhC404/VXdFRM1pJK1gVWqJGT2l9PJYW7Pgndt5CjHP8N5JQGkn5m_5PW50kH_H6lZ3p3W42CDz83RC920W4BdLtQ7Y4v76W6F-YLJ60ZR8dN5-kl4V-D8M6W6yr_Gq3hdx2_W1SHgzc7_WSKcW5bVGVk17Vy-5W2zhmvg14l8zWW3GwPFz7Vz8l1W19BXLb3FL8PWW1lznwF7gKkt0W5R_4PY27Pc90W7bq7lY2ghsMlW5H3rSJ6cSPlPV3r6hH74-LQ4W58Ft496NpX5FW3lTQWZ90gz1PW2k2J-q7qTv0wVkWCTN9bh774W4Hy3yx2XKLs5N6kGCwvfqLMjW1GPx0R7z-DHTW4Gmhwy7fvpBkN56vrG374-FJW5s-WXb3PZ49YN7_qwmRl_s2bW7T_MPL2FFMkNW8rW_zM1lXy-hW4nLHJ771LjN1W3PSGj74ljKZGW3fZS4D8jGGNBW43Hmpm1-gYRJf4v5Zjx04 ) that Google held a monopoly on web search and had acted to maintain it. In the new ruling, the judge ordered remedies to help break that monopoly, but he allowed the company to maintain its competitive position in other businesses â€” specifically browsers and smartphones â€” of interest to rival AI companies.

- Google must share a one-time snapshot of URLs and web pages it collected with all competitors that (i) demonstrate to the government they intend to compete with Google search, (ii) are technically equipped to maintain Googleâ€™s data, and (iii) do not pose a risk to the national security of the United States. However, it does not have to share updates or metadata like its assessments of webpage quality, frequency of updates, or mobile-friendliness.
- Google must syndicate its search results to competitors under the same terms it currently does to commercial partners.
- Google will not have to sell its Chrome browser or Android mobile operating system.
- Google can continue to pay partners like Apple or Mozilla to showcase its search results in their web browsers. However, it canâ€™t require that any partner use its browser exclusively.

Behind the news: The federal government filed its antitrust case against Google in 2020, well before the 2022 launch of ChatGPT. But the subsequent emergence of generative AI dramatically changed the stakes two ways, as the judge points out in his ruling. First, AI has expanded the field of information retrieval beyond traditional search engines. Second, competitors like OpenAI loosened Googleâ€™s grip on the search business in a way Bing or DuckDuckGo had not. The courtâ€™s remedies reflect this new order: Google must share its data with competitors in AI as well as search, but more drastic remedies arenâ€™t required, because AI has created robust competition in search. However, Google still faces potential remedies in a separate U.S. antitrust case (https://info.deeplearning.ai/e3t/Ctc/LX+113/cJhC404/VXdFRM1pJK1gVWqJGT2l9PJYW7Pgndt5CjHP8N5JQGlT3prCCW7Y8-PT6lZ3ngW5qF34T3K7TftN6-100QwZX-nW3l47T12P8VscW5Fg93l6Qz5lsW2fkHwh7y_mKTW4qlW2v5sHHv0W5QLrl77jqtFDW4ydcYY7sTpx9W3w_XTP4BZK75W6rPJrF7kccmlW962hQf3m8sd3W7ZSgTZ1VS3clMDnrg-ktq3vW3GTdf17ggK5mW8LCDb36wRdNjW61wVxt78ffT_W41QhkT5rCjvjW9gZRf12kSkvsW4xktHZ8zJz8jW9fbXyK65vyq-W2ND3Dx8n6wWZW70XHXW4H2PBXW1zJ16q2zMTsRW1mPLBR7WFj0jN1j3gFQXR4LFVy9qwz3C0Npsf9dn8r604 ) over its online advertising business, along with a newly levied $3.5 billion fine (https://info.deeplearning.ai/e3t/Ctc/LX+113/cJhC404/VXdFRM1pJK1gVWqJGT2l9PJYW7Pgndt5CjHP8N5JQGm83prCCW8wLKSR6lZ3pBTbb3M3-xk_4W7j8DZ06jxrzvW5MSlvp8-NTCkW2DqhgC7cytXZW3PTy9-34Bx66W1bw4dn1j1H22W3gfbSY1QZw2lW3-yFWM88DwMVW3b0QCq15RJ0_W84GmDg1NRs7DW7Wv2sc6-STYnW5VSH-P97PHWFW2dJRW43p48_3W2jtD708_cNGtW34JYvx6qMNbCN4DTs29WxxhCW72SH-74VjG8sN1sWRZscp2pJVXrsSL8QdWgbN4v7rVZKfBHgW8yqzQk2g7yhvN2mBx0dsJ-B1W8kkPfs98h7NyW6FxQqY3QH-fjW8QNtP06RSypvW2jg69W91df9MW3Y8hPQ42tYcSW1X5-fS5pX-PqdJkdnW04 ) by European antitrust courts.

Why it matters: The courtâ€™s ruling reflects the growing strength of AI companies in the business of retrieving information. However, it provides only limited openings to Googleâ€™s AI competitors and stops short of giving them broad opportunities to challenge the company. Had the judge ordered Google to sell off Chrome or Android â€” browsers and smartphones being major avenues that drive users to a search engine as well as opportunities for broad enhancement by AI â€” other AI companies would have a better shot at competing with Google Search.

Weâ€™re thinking: The judge said predicting the future of AI and search would require a crystal ball. Nonetheless, itâ€™s already clear that large language models are taking over a significant part of the role once played by traditional search engines. Fostering competition could lead to even better products for helping users find information.

2 Hours With AI Versus 6 With Teacher

A growing private school system replaces the typical 6-hour school day with 2 hours of personalized, AI-assisted education.

Whatâ€™s new: Alpha School, which teaches 250 preschool-through-high-school students in Austin, Texas, uses an AI-powered method that presents challenges that are tailored to a studentâ€™s level of mastery, doubling the speed of learning, the company claims. Alpha School has built a method and infrastructure for delivering personalized academic education in a way that enables students to learn efficiently, freeing up time for social learning and personal development.

Weâ€™re thinking: The press has spilled much ink on how to keep AI from helping students cheat. Instead, letâ€™s focus on how AI can help students learn.

10 Million Tokens of Input Context

An alternative to attention enables large language models to track relationships among words across extraordinarily wide spans of text.

Whatâ€™s new: Ali Behrouz and colleagues at Google devised a trainable component they call a memory module that stores and retrieves an inputâ€™s semantic content. The authors integrated this component into a transformer-like architecture, ATLAS (https://info.deeplearning.ai/e3t/Ctc/LX+113/cJhC404/VXdFRM1pJK1gVWqJGT2l9PJYW7Pgndt5CjHP8N5JQGlg3prCCW6N1vHY6lZ3pNW3DwYHw7zBdbJN8cMRMH1mQYHW3MSxZk2YwdRDW4y3Bky42tyHKW7KKRKh3lClhmW6fq-d36TfjrBW7qNj7B5__HHPW3kDYW-5PnNlwW4V_STW5jJJy3W9fQz8q8NfGTrW1npzZN1CLL7lVxY4l44CqnSBV3V6Pf2P5L_5W944zJR9jF_XwW2Cpmd73-N39rW2w2j2Y4l0M5fF5v_50KxZ_yW2cf9Jf4rZgNDW2jvz4z67j58_TNY1T2JNSmYN1sRpT8XPqqvW3zXxPG2dD-71f6g4jWC04 ) , that can process up to 10 million tokens of input.

Key insight: Given a text token, a recurrent neural network computes a vector that represents it, which it updates when it receives the next token, and so on, so it remembers what it has processed so far. However, the vector may lose relevant information over many input tokens. An alternative is to dedicate a part of the network, or module, to generating a representation of the input and update its weights at inference. The module acts something like a retriever: When it receives sequences of tokens that are similar to those it received previously, it retrieves stored representations of the earlier sequence enriched with the latest context. In this way, it can interpret new input tokens in light of previous ones, like a typical recurrent neural network, without needing to examine all input tokens at once, like a transformer.

How it works: ATLAS replaces a transformerâ€™s attention layers with a trainable memory module. The authors trained a 1.3 billion-parameter model to predict the next token in the FineWeb (https://info.deeplearning.ai/e3t/Ctc/LX+113/cJhC404/VXdFRM1pJK1gVWqJGT2l9PJYW7Pgndt5CjHP8N5JQGlg3prCCW6N1vHY6lZ3pKW39-LWz3jctwhW7Ql3XN1CQh7WW6kzJnH2fJM87W20Xnwz2tdNr1W653C7Y52b6C_W8DNCgW2GGMHMW4d6vsP6VRcyWW3x3nKL1MVyxhW1pS-kY70ZLYqW6sbD0y7vQYZZW5QR7w56n4NJCW1N5j1W1H1q8pVwHJJk7ScJHNN6lbCG5Pms5cW48YcBt5YS4w4W4p3FT22S--WWW5JCJ9n8_JtY8W6SmP-v3ZnLfcW8fyLC717c8PKW4tf4rL1g45rdMpzPzCnvBGYW6TLggV3T7mFgd2YlQq04 )  dataset of text from the web. During training, ATLAS learned good base values for the memory moduleâ€™s weights, to be further modified at inference.

- Given text tokens, ATLAS used linear projections to transform them (a sliding context window of the last 2 tokens) into a key used to find related information and a value containing that information.
- The memory module, made up of fully connected layers, received the transformed key and produced a predicted value.

ATLAS compared the predicted value to the actual value and updated the memory moduleâ€™s weights to minimize the difference, effectively learning which keys retrieve which values.
- At inference, the modelâ€™s parameters were frozen except the memory modelâ€™s weights, which reset after each session.

Results: The authors compared ATLAS to other models of the same size that were trained on the same number of tokens. ATLAS performed best, especially in long-context tasks.

- On BABILong (https://info.deeplearning.ai/e3t/Ctc/LX+113/cJhC404/VXdFRM1pJK1gVWqJGT2l9PJYW7Pgndt5CjHP8N5JQGlg3prCCW6N1vHY6lZ3nyW5MFPVJ6L5zsQW63vg0L4Kd00XW4zb9HX5yTglKN8H5R7Q5fwnLW868Q2734Xx-yW400kX924v5GgW71lX3P7NXy2_W2bkSlg4B8yThW7Lq6g04tvfVZN7-DPkpQYq0MW22jt-D5v2mBtVpK-Jj83FBwxW7Yw4ss3KnhfGW3jhwz68bqtMXW2MN2ly9fwtsLW1bjZL27LSF9_W1Qtxs01Rdj-lW7Ncy0m8-gQ44VrRhKb8Mm4j5W6_lNxP7Bdl5bW6DkrCz5Kjw6fW27Qbft3S88ZFf6VkwdH04 )  (answering questions about long texts), given 10 million tokens, ATLAS achieved 80 percent accuracy. Titans, a long-term memory architecture that updates its weights based on the most recently processed token, achieved approximately 70 percent accuracy. (To put these numbers in context, GPT-4â€™s accuracy fell from 80 percent given 1,000 tokens to below 40 percent given 100,000 tokens; its maximum input length is 128,000 tokens.
- Across 8 question-answering benchmarks, ATLAS averaged 57.62 percent accuracy, while Transformer++ averaged 52.25 percent accuracy.

Yes, but: The authors tested ATLAS at relatively small size 1.3 billion parameters. How it would perform at larger scales is unclear.

Why it matters: Keeping track of very long inputs remains a challenge (https://info.deeplearning.ai/e3t/Ctc/LX+113/cJhC404/VXdFRM1pJK1gVWqJGT2l9PJYW7Pgndt5CjHP8N5JQGlz3prCCW7lCdLW6lZ3ldW3gXJ3257NsczW5hX_4s5brGnnW4Q-57f4f8C_xN27ByklxtSsFW6DrGC35bYTxkW8JR-G95rN3zDW8rlTy76shLq-W7jclBY2sFXVlW3MCytY3JH_m7W774zbT2KFXxTW4w96t02ZXqJPW5Lb-D627KLz3W7zCPmh4HQN5_N50k4l36kLq9W3jcjsT8DVMN_W1nSDpw5MRM1nW4ZXLPq6TWWJVW6wjD8x7S92KrW1bkDgW90SyLNW87pBLq7SZWM9W8xh1w84TgzGMW6TGjRX80dnznW4C8Xc839kjxqMn3qMXJtG7ddFVLn404 ) for most LLMs, and processing more than 2 million tokens â€” the current limit of Google Gemini 2.5 Pro â€” is a wild frontier. ATLAS updates parameters at inference to maintain context through extraordinarily long inputs, potentially opening up applications that involve data-dense inputs such as video at full resolution and frame rate.

Weâ€™re thinking: ATLAS extends context to 10 million tokens â€” far greater than the vast majority of models. What will such very long context be useful for? How will we evaluate model performance over such long inputs? What tradeoffs come with using more tokens versus better context engineering? ATLAS may push such questions further into the foreground.

subject: Sreeja Thati, Join LeetCode Contest and get ready for interview prep!
body:
Compete Weekly And Win Prizes

 

ï»¿ï»¿Compete in Weekly Contest 467 Sponsored by LeetCode! Win up to 5000 LeetCode Coins per contest, as well as bonus prizes! You can also win a chance to be shortlisted with LeetCode! Register and fill out the survey here! Not sure if you are ready for interviews? Participating in contests gives you real world feedback on how well you do compared to other candidates. We carefully select real interview questions which are well-suited to real interviews.

Calling all content creators! LeetCode is hiring a Solution Author to join our problem creation team. Please see our announcement post and apply now!

Weekly Contest 467 starts at 07:30 PM PDT Saturday (10:30 AM Beijing Time Sunday), and Biweekly Contest 165 starts at 07:30 AM PDT Saturday (10:30 PM Beijing Time Saturday). You will have 1.5 hours to solve a few interesting interview problems. If you participate in both contests, you will receive an additional bonus of 35 LeetCoins!

For each contest, the top 200 coders win prizes:

 

â€¢ 1st place wins 5000 LeetCoins.

â€¢ 2nd place wins 2500 LeetCoins.

â€¢ 3rd place wins 1000 LeetCoins.

â€¢ 4th - 50th place win 300 LeetCoins.

â€¢ 51st - 100th place win 100 LeetCoins.

â€¢ 101st - 200th place win 50 LeetCoins.

â€¢ Solve at least one problem to win 5 LeetCoins.

â€¢ Participate in both contests to win 35 LeetCoins.

See you on the scoreboard and good luck!

Join now!

Sincerely,
The LeetCode Team

Knowledge Graphs fpr AI Agent API Discovery promotional banner with "Enroll Now" CTA (https://info.deeplearning.ai/e3t/Ctc/LX+113/cJhC404/VVBJNd4PpqSyW18CYsL120_VPW3S9mTt5ChpdKN7qyl183prCCW95jsWP6lZ3mrW5d4zsr1d2z6MW4rXx0B3G01vtW9303LD9dZVZ_W8LPW8M8-Xh_gW8CgzTh9gMZR5W2ZsNB38WPlNkW6TBWkK3_r6FzW6cxKqr5BFzGhW8Qvcts6tXYjWW28mFTd3n4BXhW6tNJhn7gsQCcW92GNVq772Hk8W42y-tv2T_Ps0W6fqPfb8glYRFW1ybrxy3MHppFW827zzl3C14GwW381VwN4-yb7jW4hRv_p51RNW_N7MVdWP8GZpfW3VQpQf7dX4zcW5_l2Hs8LMfPvW1Tk2bX2NWQlJW1VxhM8867tKnW1Vwg364qWQFlW8LHxvS536Q6xW2sL06n2X4f2PW5QVh1f5gGYmVW8xMMgN3Kg1qvW7VqkF14QnP6yW7kLYNK2JWlYXf2hXWVg04 )

Dear Sreeja,

Weâ€™re launching a new short course in collaboration with SAP: Knowledge Graphs for AI Agent API Discovery (https://info.deeplearning.ai/e3t/Ctc/LX+113/cJhC404/VVBJNd4PpqSyW18CYsL120_VPW3S9mTt5ChpdKN7qyl183prCCW95jsWP6lZ3mrW5d4zsr1d2z6MW4rXx0B3G01vtW9303LD9dZVZ_W8LPW8M8-Xh_gW8CgzTh9gMZR5W2ZsNB38WPlNkW6TBWkK3_r6FzW6cxKqr5BFzGhW8Qvcts6tXYjWW28mFTd3n4BXhW6tNJhn7gsQCcW92GNVq772Hk8W42y-tv2T_Ps0W6fqPfb8glYRFW1ybrxy3MHppFW827zzl3C14GwW381VwN4-yb7jW4hRv_p51RNW_N7MVdWP8GZpfW3VQpQf7dX4zcW5_l2Hs8LMfPvW1Tk2bX2NWQlJW1VxhM8867tKnW1Vwg364qWQFlW8LHxvS536Q6xW2sL06n2X4f2PW5QVh1f5gGYmVW8xMMgN3Kg1qvW7VqkF14QnP6yW7kLYNK2JWlYXf2hXWVg04 ) , taught by Pavithra G K (Head of Business Knowledge Graphs) and Lars Heling (Senior Knowledge Engineer) at SAP Business AI.

AI agents can access thousands of APIs for tasks like purchase orders or data access, but with so many options, agents often miss the right API or call endpoints out of order, limiting effectiveness in enterprise workflows. This course shows how a knowledge graph can guide both API discovery and execution.

Enroll for Free
(https://info.deeplearning.ai/e3t/Ctc/LX+113/cJhC404/VVBJNd4PpqSyW18CYsL120_VPW3S9mTt5ChpdKN7qyl183prCCW95jsWP6lZ3mrW5d4zsr1d2z6MW4rXx0B3G01vtW9303LD9dZVZ_W8LPW8M8-Xh_gW8CgzTh9gMZR5W2ZsNB38WPlNkW6TBWkK3_r6FzW6cxKqr5BFzGhW8Qvcts6tXYjWW28mFTd3n4BXhW6tNJhn7gsQCcW92GNVq772Hk8W42y-tv2T_Ps0W6fqPfb8glYRFW1ybrxy3MHppFW827zzl3C14GwW381VwN4-yb7jW4hRv_p51RNW_N7MVdWP8GZpfW3VQpQf7dX4zcW5_l2Hs8LMfPvW1Tk2bX2NWQlJW1VxhM8867tKnW1Vwg364qWQFlW8LHxvS536Q6xW2sL06n2X4f2PW5QVh1f5gGYmVW8xMMgN3Kg1qvW7VqkF14QnP6yW7kLYNK2JWlYXf2hXWVg04 )

In this course, youâ€™ll learn to:

- Construct a knowledge graph from API services and endpoints and visualize it.
- Extend the knowledge graph with business process data, so APIs are connected via the process and their dependencies.
- Learn how knowledge graphs can be used for API discovery for AI agents, perform semantic retrieval, and add business-process edges to get all the required APIs and their order.
- Build an agent that uses the knowledge graph to discover and execute APIs following the right process order.

By the end, youâ€™ll have a knowledge graph from API specifications and business process information, and an agent that discovers the right APIs and executes them in the right order.

If youâ€™re an AI builder working with large API ecosystems who need agents to choose the right services and call them in order, this course is perfect for you!

subject: The 3 fears keeping you broke
body:
During last weekâ€™s community call, Doug shared something that
caught my attention.

Heâ€™d pitched $26,000 to a client he wasnâ€™t even enjoying working
with, hoping theyâ€™d say no.

They said yes!

Then hired him for another $50,000.

Meanwhile, I know Maker School members building sophisticated
automation systems and charging $350.

Same skillset. Same market.

But 200x price difference!

Three specific fears keep people stuck pitching low prices:

---------------------------------------------------------
Fear #1: â€œClients wonâ€™t tell me how much money they makeâ€
---------------------------------------------------------

This fear is completely misguided.

Business owners live in spreadsheets. They track revenue, costs,
margins, growth rates, customer lifetime value. Numbers are their
language.

Theyâ€™re not hiding their financials from you. Theyâ€™re waiting for
you to prove you understand their business.

Wrong question: â€œHow much revenue do you make?â€

Right question: â€œIf I could get you one more client like your
best client, whatâ€™s that worth?â€

Theyâ€™ll light up: â€œOur best clients pay $8,000 upfront and
typically stay for 18 months at $3k per month each, so thatâ€™s
about $59,000 in lifetime value.â€

Business owners want ROI. They want to know the math works. Give
them a framework to see the value, and theyâ€™ll do the
calculations for you.

--------------------------------------------------
Fear #2: â€œWhat if I canâ€™t deliver what I promise?â€
--------------------------------------------------

Two solutions here:

Short-term: Make a guarantee.

If you donâ€™t deliver the promised value, refund their money.
Simple.

Hereâ€™s the thingâ€”you get paid either way:

* Deliver great results: You get paid money + learning
* Donâ€™t deliver: You get paid in learning + reputation for
honesty

Most clients respect someone who stands behind their work more
than someone who hedges with weak guarantees.

Long-term: You just get better.

After 5-10 projects, youâ€™ll know exactly what you can deliver.
Doug didnâ€™t need a guarantee for his $76,000 project because heâ€™d
built confidence through experience.

The fear of not delivering is solved by delivering. Start with
guarantees, build your track record, then price with confidence.

---------------------------------------------------
Fear #3: â€œWhat if they say no and I lose the deal?â€
---------------------------------------------------

This is scarcity thinking, and itâ€™s killing your income.

The solution isnâ€™t better pricing tactics. The solution is more
leads.

When you have 10 qualified prospects, losing one doesnâ€™t matter.
Youâ€™ll price confidently because youâ€™re not desperate.

When you have 1 prospect and rent is due next week, youâ€™ll
undercharge every time.

Doug could price $26,000 and not care about the outcome because
he had other opportunities lined up. The abundance mindset let
him charge what the work was actually worth.

The math is simple:

* 1 lead = scarcity pricing = $350 projects
* 10 leads = abundance pricing = $3,000+ projects

Generate more opportunities. Pricing becomes easy.

----------------
The real problem
----------------

Most people think value-based pricing is about asking better
questions or having more confidence.

Itâ€™s not. Itâ€™s about solving these three fears:

* Get comfortable with money conversations - Business owners want
to talk ROI
* Build delivery confidence - Start with guarantees, develop
expertise
* Create lead abundance - Multiple opportunities eliminate
desperate pricing

Dougâ€™s $76,000 story isnâ€™t about being a better negotiator. Itâ€™s
about not being afraid.

Fix the fears and watch the pricing fix itself.

Talk soon,

Nick

PS - The most successful Maker School members arenâ€™t the most
experienced. Theyâ€™re the ones who learned to overcome these three
fears first.

If you want the exact frameworks for confident pricing
conversations and lead generation systems that create abundance,
thatâ€™s what we cover inside the program.

Shruthika Sunku posted: From Student to Mentor - A Journey of Growth and Giving Back 

I recently completed my mentorship journey at Smart Interviews (January to June 2025), and it's been one of the most rewarding experiences of my career.
When I was selected as a mentor, I felt both honored and excited. I recalled my own journey with DSA, including the initial learning curve, breakthrough moments, and how Smart Interviews had been instrumental in strengthening my foundation. Now I had the chance to provide the same guidance that once helped me excel.

What Smart Interviews gave me as a student:Â 
ğŸ”¹ A solid foundation in DSA that opened doors to amazing opportunitiesÂ 
ğŸ”¹ Problem-solving frameworks that I still use todayÂ 
ğŸ”¹ The confidence to approach challenging problems head-on

What mentoring taught me in return:Â 
ğŸ”¹ Patience - Learning to break down complex problems into simpler stepsÂ 
ğŸ”¹ Clarity - Realizing that if I couldn't explain a concept simply, I didn't understand it deep enoughÂ 
ğŸ”¹ Empathy - Recognizing the same struggles I once faced and guiding with encouragement, not just solutions 

The beautiful irony? While I thought I was just helping others learn DSA, I was actually strengthening my own understanding. Each mentoring session became a learning opportunity for me too.

Smart Interviews didn't just help me master algorithms; it helped me grab opportunities. Being able to give back as a mentor and provide the same support I once received has been one of the most fulfilling experiences of my journey.

To my juniors who trusted my guidance, and to my instructor DEVI PRASAD JOSHI sir, and the entire Smart Interviews team, thank you for this transformative opportunity! 

#Mentorship #SmartInterviews #DSA #ProblemSolving #CodingJourney

subject: Google Cloud Gen AI Exchange: Register Before Time Runs Out
body:
Your Code. India’s Next Breakthrough.

 

Join hundreds of innovators building next-generation AI solutions with Google Cloud's cutting-edge tools. Compete nationally. Collaborate locally.

 

Secure your spot

 

Hi Sreeja Thati,

 

A quick reminder—your Gen AI Exchange Hackathon application is still pending. Spots are filling fast, but your journey can continue with just one more step.

By completing your registration, you will:

 

Collaborate and Build as a Team

Tackle Enterprise - Grade Challenges

Access Expert-Led Google Cloud AI Labs

Compete for Prestigious Awards

Create or join a team of up to 5 members. Work alongside some of India’s brightest minds.

Engage with real-world problem statements curated by leading organisations.

Participate in immersive, hands-on learning workshops in select cities. 

Advance to the national finale, where you stand a chance to win from a â‚¹65 lakh prize pool.
 

Don’t let this opportunity pass you by. Complete your registration and take your skills to the national stage. Registration closes on September 5th, 2025.

 

Finish your signup now
 

In case of any query, mail us at: genaiexchangesupport@hack2skill.com 

 

Regards,
